title: Quiz 1: Concept of Community & Family Structures
description: Assess your understanding of community definitions, family types, and their functions within the community health context.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ is defined as a group of people living in a certain geographical area and working together for a common goal.
questions.explanation: A community is a group of people living in a certain geographical area and working together for a common goal, sharing resources and risks.
questions.hint: It is the central unit of study in this course.

questions.question: Match the type of family with its correct description:

pairs.right: Husband, wife, and children (family of procreation)
Includes aunts, uncles, cousins, and grandparents
One parent bringing up children alone
Spouses bring unrelated children from previous marriages

questions.explanation: Nuclear=immediate; Extended=joint/relatives; Single Parent=one parent; Blended=step-families/unrelated children.
questions.hint: Think about the composition of members in each family unit.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized functions of a community? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Producing and distributing goods and services

questions.explanation: Communities function to share information, socialize members, produce/distribute goods, and protect rights. Isolation is contrary to community function.
questions.hint: Think about what a community does for its members collectively.

questions.question: The family is the largest recognized group of individuals in a community.
questions.explanation: The family is the **smallest** recognized group of individuals in a community, not the largest.
questions.hint: Consider the hierarchy of social groups.

questions.question: Which system is NOT listed as one of the eight essential sub-systems of a community?
questions.explanation: The Planetary System is not a community sub-system. The 8 sub-systems include Socio-cultural, Political, Economic, Education, Religious, Environmental, Communication, and Health Care.
questions.hint: Which one refers to astronomy rather than sociology?

questions.question: What term describes all those things which people learn, share, and pass on to later generations, including language and beliefs?
questions.explanation: Culture is defined as the shared learning, beliefs, customs, and language passed down through generations.
questions.hint: It defines a group's way of life.

questions.question: Review the list of characteristics below. Which one indicates a **Healthy Community**?

richContent.content:
• High crime rates
  • Availability of stable income sources
  • Poor leadership
  • Overcrowding

questions.explanation: Gainful occupational activities (stable income) are a characteristic of a healthy community. The others are problems affecting health.
questions.hint: Look for the positive attribute among the negatives.

questions.question: Arrange the following family types from smallest basic unit to most complex composition:
questions.explanation: The hierarchy starts with the Individual, forms a Nuclear Family, expands to an Extended Family, and these units make up the Community.
questions.hint: Start with one person and zoom out.

questions.question: In the context of community sub-systems, which system is primarily responsible for changing behavior and eliminating ignorance?
questions.explanation: The Education System is the main tool for changing behavior, improving health, and eliminating ignorance.
questions.hint: Where do people go to learn and gain knowledge?

questions.question: A healthy community is characterized by a ___BLANK___ approach to tackling community problems.
questions.explanation: A healthy community uses a communal approach and participation to tackle its problems.
